name: Real Casona de las Amas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this place for its location enroute from Madrid to the northern coast of Spain but still acceptably close to the sights of Rioja. They required an upfront deposit only partially refundable so when I started having second thoughts I realized I was stuck if I didn’t want to forfeit a sizable chunk of change. As it turned out the place was fine but it did have a number of drawbacks that make me unable to recommend it to others even as I dispute some of the reviews that caused me to have second thoughts in the first place
reviews.title: Too bad, this place could be great

likes.disliked: — Inhospitable attitude of greater concern from hotel funishings than for guest comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For starters the town it’s in, Azofra, is not just minimal, it’s miserable. Nothing there except a couple of bars and a square if you can call it that. And the exterior of the hotel is so understated that we drove by it twice before finally finding the entrance which requires that you ring the bell. That alone was completely symbolic of the place—unapproachable and certainly not inviting.
reviews.title: A big disappointment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place has terrific basics, just bad management who are anal about the care—not of the guests, but of their investment in the furnishings. There are no mini-fridges in the room and indeed no drinks of any sort (except the clear water provided) are even allowed in the rooms, even if you purchase them at the bar downstairs. (We felt like school kids sneaking our bottles of wine in in my purse.) There are only two places in the room to put non-hanging clothes, a single drawer in the bottom of the wardrobe and a small drawer in the writing desk. The giant bathroom which sports lovely hand-painted fixtures has no hooks to hang clothes on. Everything has been thought of and no expense spared to decorate the place, but no thought has been given to the comfort and convenience of the guests. Even the parking lot was roped off (too pretty to drive on?) and guests were expected to find street parking—not a hardship since no tourists were visiting this beauty forsaken town.
reviews.title: Give this one a miss

aka: Real Casona De Las Amas Azofra, La Rioja, Spain
description: This luxury boutique hotel restored from a 17th century palace is considered by public authorities as a building of cultural interest. It retains the warmth of the past without giving up modern facilities in line with today standards. Its wonderful decoration offers diverse styles that evoke a sense of past times.Located in the town of Azofra, it has a strategic location in the heart of La Rioja Alta. The Rioja Region offers visitors a great many varied attractions and the region is of great cultural interest being the cradle of the Spanish language and traversed by Pilgrim’s Way to Santiago. It offers a wealth of wines and gastronomy, ancestral feasts and traditions, and a wide range of natural landscapes where its peoples are hearty and sociable.The communal areas are divided into three zones, a Florentine-Style Lobby, a lounge zone and a library. All of them offer a relaxed family atmosphere. The main hall is an inviting room both in winter, with its welcoming fireplace, and in summer, with its delightful natural illumination. The bar and second hall are two places to enjoy a cup of tea in the afternoon or an aperitif before supper. The original floorboards, large comfortable sofas, elegant antiques and the prevailing grey and reddish hues of the décor, invite one to read, rest or chat with friends after enjoying any of the numerous activities offered by La Rioja and its environments. In addition, you can connect to Internet by Wi-Fi access.
